1.7.1.title: Certification Requirements
1.7.1.content:
All personnel with well control responsibilities shall hold appropriate certifications.

**Recognized Certification Bodies:**
- IWCF (International Well Control Forum)
- IADC WellSharp
- Equivalent national certifications as approved

**Certification Levels:**

| Position | Minimum Certification |
|----------|----------------------|
| Driller | IWCF Level 4 or WellSharp Driller |
| Assistant Driller | IWCF Level 3 or WellSharp Supervisor |
| Toolpusher | IWCF Level 4 or WellSharp Driller |
| Drilling Supervisor | IWCF Level 4 or WellSharp Driller |
| OIM | IWCF Level 4 or WellSharp Driller |

**Stack Type:**
Certification must match the operation:
- Surface operations: Surface stack certification
- Subsea operations: Combined (Surface + Subsea) certification

1.7.2.title: Certification Validity
1.7.2.content:
**Validity Period:**
IWCF and WellSharp certifications are valid for 2 years from date of issue.

**Renewal:**
- Personnel must renew before expiration
- Expired certifications are not valid
- Planning should ensure renewal in advance of expiration

**Lapsed Certifications:**
Personnel with lapsed certifications:
- Cannot perform well control duties
- Must be reassigned until renewed
- May require full recertification rather than renewal

**Verification:**
- Certifications verified before assignment
- Copies maintained on file
- Original certificate or verifiable digital credential required

1.7.3.title: Training Requirements
1.7.3.content:
Beyond certification, ongoing training is required:

**Induction Training:**
All well control personnel receive:
- Rig-specific orientation
- BOP and equipment familiarization
- Current well status and hazards
- Emergency procedures and muster
- Communication systems

**Ongoing Training:**
- Participation in well control drills
- Equipment operation practice
- Procedure reviews
- Incident lessons learned
- New equipment or procedure training

**Simulator Training:**
Simulator-based training is recommended:
- Initial: As part of certification
- Refresher: Annually where available
- Advanced: For supervisory positions

1.7.4.title: On-Board Training Program
1.7.4.content:
Each installation shall maintain an on-board well control training program:

**Components:**

**1. Computer-Based Training**
- Well control principles review
- Procedure familiarization
- Calculation practice
- Available 24/7

**2. Simulator Sessions (where equipped)**
- Team-based scenarios
- Kill procedure practice
- Decision-making exercises
- Duration: 1-2 hours per session

**3. Equipment Drills**
- BOP function testing observation
- Choke operation practice
- Shut-in procedure walk-through

**Frequency:**
- Weekly: At least one training element
- Monthly: Full team exercise or scenario
- Per tour: Orientation for new arrivals

1.7.5.title: Competency Assessment
1.7.5.content:
Personnel competency shall be verified beyond certification:

**Assessment Methods:**
- Observation during operations
- Performance in drills
- Knowledge checks
- Peer feedback
- Incident review participation

**Competency Areas:**
- Technical knowledge (procedures, calculations)
- Practical skills (equipment operation)
- Decision-making (scenario responses)
- Communication (crew interaction)
- Leadership (for supervisory roles)

**Documentation:**
- Training records maintained
- Drill participation logged
- Assessment results recorded
- Development needs identified

**Addressing Gaps:**
- Additional training provided
- Mentoring assigned
- Reassignment if competency cannot be achieved

1.7.6.title: Special Operations Training
1.7.6.content:
Personnel involved in special operations require additional training:

**HPHT Operations:**
- HPHT-specific well control training
- Narrow window drilling awareness
- Enhanced monitoring techniques
- HPHT equipment familiarization

**MPD Operations:**
- MPD principles and equipment
- MPD-specific barrier management
- RCD operations
- Transition to conventional well control

**Deepwater Operations:**
- Subsea BOP systems
- Choke line friction effects
- Riser margin considerations
- EDS procedures
- Hydrate awareness

**H2S Operations:**
- H2S properties and hazards
- Detection equipment
- Breathing apparatus use
- Rescue procedures
- Well control in H2S environment

1.7.7.title: Training Records
1.7.7.content:
Complete training records shall be maintained:

**Required Records:**
- Certification copies and validity dates
- Training course completions
- Drill participation dates and results
- Assessment results
- Development plans

**Retention:**
- Active personnel: Current plus previous certification period
- After departure: Per regulatory requirements (typically 3-5 years)

**Availability:**
- Records available for audit
- Summary available to personnel on request
- Electronic records backed up
